item.title: ANOVA
item.description: In many problems, we have to test if the distributions of several groups are the same. We will use the null hypothesis: The distributions of several groups are the same. ANOVA tests the null hypothesis by comparing the variability between groups and within groups. If the variability between groups are significantly larger than the variability within groups, we are more confident that the distributions of different groups are different. We will use two groups as an example.
